page.title: 03THE MANCHESTER SHIP CANAL
page.content:
The canal takes ocean-going ships from the{River Mersey}at Liverpool, through the Cheshire countryside, to the inland docks at Manchester.
It is a wide, man-made waterway dating back to the end of the 19th century. In our area you can walk right up to the canal. A little to the West this is impossible since the canal is tidal and flows in a deep cutting.
There were two{ferries}at one time but now only one remains at Thelwall.
It seems that very soon the canal is to close. Many people will lose their jobs when this happens but in recent years trade through the canal has dropped making it uneconomical.
